intro: Ornithogalum visianicum, commonly known as the Visianic star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has strap-like, grassy leaves. It is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
